website_summaries.verdict: A good USB hub from Sabrent meant for people wanting more USB ports for various devices.
pros: 13 dedicated USB 2.0 ports provide enough connectivity and charging capabilities for several devices at the same time
Hub is long and narrow for easy storage and transportation
cons: USB ports use the older 2.0 architecture, limiting the possible data transfer speed and device compatibility

customer_reviews.title: Two Magic Buttons
customer_reviews.text: I thought this USB hub was broken! Half of the lights weren't lighting up. It turns out there are two buttons that control the lights. You can have all the lights on, half of them on, or have them all turned off. It plugs into the wall and into a usb port on your computer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Intermittent Connections!
customer_reviews.text: I got so annoyed at this device when my usb optical mouse and keyboard started cutting in and out especially when I was gaming! The usb hub was plugged into the power so it shouldn't be disconnecting but it is. I don't have many usb port on my i7 laptop and needed something affordable to get more usb ports. I guess you get what you pay for. This is a bad product. I should've read the other reviews claiming usb connection issues. I'm beyond my return window so if I can't return this product, I'm leaving an honest review. I hope someone out there reads this review and doesn't make the same mistake I did. DO NOT BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Allen S.

customer_reviews.title: Great as a hub, I'm sure. They just don't charge.
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this hub is great for syncing various USB-driven devices with a computer. However, due to really unclear wording, I bought two intending on using them to charge a number of iPads in my classroom. After asking a question on Amazon, I was directed to call technical support, who told me that these aren't intended to charge. I really think that should be made more clear in the description. For anyone here for the same purpose I was, THESE DO NOT CHARGE AT ALL. I'll be returning them, as they don't do the one thing I bought them to do. However, on the positive side, they do light up and I'm sure they act well as hubs.
customer_reviews.author: chicaso

customer_reviews.title: Dont unplug it!
customer_reviews.text: so if you unplug this thing...your computer will blue screen and crash seen so many memory dumps this week im kinda getting tired of it as a massive PRO GPU/CPU over clock guy this is even too much for me was fine till i tried to unplug the main usb that goes into the computer...thats when everything goes wrong.... seems to be over volting my computers usb ports and blowing out my usb ports,had to replace them and this is just getting annoying, can they just charge me 99$ for super 100% well made products so i dont gotta deal with this kinda stuff?
customer_reviews.author: Lord Wood

customer_reviews.title: Works only for non iOS devices
customer_reviews.text: I bought this, because I typically have 3 things plugged in and charging at one time. So I purchased this for that reason. I found out it only works with my kindle device(s) and android phones. It will not charge iPhones, iPads, or iPods. They take too much power. So I paid 20.00 for something that I cannot use effectively and now have to buy something else that will do the job that this was meant to do. I talked to the manufacturer and they said, "You have a working product." effectively telling me that there's nothing that they will do because their information does not tell you it will not charge iOS devices.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Busenbark

customer_reviews.title: Returning for a refund.
customer_reviews.text: Completely false advertising as far as speed goes. I have a 7 port unit by another manufacturer that I use to copy videos I make to SD cards in an USB adapter. That one takes 20 minutes to program all of them. This Sabrent takes 4 HOURS using the same USB port and the same 7 SD cards in the same USB adapters. Returning for a refund before I die of old age waiting!
customer_reviews.author: Spitfire

customer_reviews.title: *whistles* Nice Hub, honey !
customer_reviews.text: While I haven't had enough time to test the product's capabilities. re: power consumption, I however, have had enough time to get everything plugged in and lit up, and this seems to be a perfect solution to my minor computer issue of not having enough USB ports on my Dell Laptop. For me, 4 just wasn't enough. Thanks to the seller, package arrive on-time and well put together. Definitely would recommend. Thanks, again !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I've had this USB hub for only about a month. I normally only use one half of the strip and leave the other 6 slots off unless I need to use them. Today when I plugged my trackpad into one of the empty slots for charging and turned on the other half of the hub, everything connected to both sides was disconnected including my external hard drives. I had an important project open and luckily didn't lose any data. Won't be taking my chances with this thing again. I got this to replace my Plug-able usb hub I had for years. Go with that one instead if you're looking for something reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Pascarelli

customer_reviews.title: GREAT product!
customer_reviews.text: I'm absolutely thrilled with this gadget! I plugged it into the back of my iMAC & I now have a small thumb drive, several devices - including my craft hot knife! ( which works great through this device, BTW! ) & a 1TB external thumb drive connected & everything works amazingly well! I have enough empty sockets to allow recharging the USB rechargeable batteries I just bought - this charged all 4 of them perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Dancing Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!
customer_reviews.text: I run my own business from my home so I have two extra external hard drives, a barcode printer, speakers and a scanner that need USB ports. My iMac only has 2 ports, so I was using one port hub then added a second one. Most port hubs aren't straight like this one and plug in on all sides which makes a mess. I've now eliminated both hubs for this one and it tucks in right behind my monitor. It can't be seen and the mess of wires is gone! I highly recommend this product! It does come with an AC plug so you can run peripherals that need the power.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay A. Richards

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: About the only thing you can count on with this hub is that is will seldom work. First, the power supply is way under powered. after plugging in a device or two, the hub dies. Oh, and the design of the hub side plug for that supply is so poorly designed that is simply falls out if you look at it. When that happens, it shuts down with even one thing plugged in. If you want an actual, working USB hub, look elsewhere. I had to.
customer_reviews.author: James K. Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, no-nonsense USB hub, great price
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a USB hub that I could attached to the bottom of my desk and this seems to be the only one that has mounting holes to do so. This is a no-nonsense hub and does exactly what I needed it to do and nothing more. The first two inputs have on/off switches, which aren't totally necessary for me. The only issue I have with this hub is that the USB cable is permanently attached. I had to purchase an extension cable because I needed it to be about 6 feet from the computer. It would have been better if it used a plug-in USB cable instead of having it permanently attached.
customer_reviews.author: Steven R. Gordon

customer_reviews.title: On a second unit
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these beasties several months ago, and found that there may be a loose wire in the USB plug. I connect to the computer via a USB extension, and brushing against it resulted in resets. I bought a replacement unit, and there is no problem. Presently I have 7 USB flash drives plugged in (six 256-GB and one 128-GB), plus three WD external drives (one 1-TB and two 2-TB). All of them are working well. It's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: KorMan

customer_reviews.title: So nice, I bought a second one
customer_reviews.text: My basement circular desk design has bi-lateral symmetry ( identical right and left sides). Got one of these for the right side and reasoned that I needed a second unit on the left. Nicely designed and quite functional without any 'creative' design shapes. It's just a slim rectangular shape, designed for efficiency and that's all I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Higgs

customer_reviews.title: after 4 usb devices it stops working
customer_reviews.text: so after 4 devices get plugged into this thing it stops putting out power to the devices, so I wont be buying another one. I would avoid. And yes I am plugging it into the wall. I have an alexa speaker, usb keyboard/mouse combo bluettooth plugged in, microphone, and a laptop fan, and thats all it would take.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Too bright for a bedroom
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to go next to my bed. The LED blue light is overwhelmingly bright. I have to dump a pillowcase on it if I want to get power AND sleep. This product, in addition, does not work on any Apple products. The USB strip works fine if light is not an issue. For anyone who does not want a spotlight of blue illuminating the room, chose another product.
customer_reviews.author: Anne S.

customer_reviews.title: Where has this been all my life?
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this usb hub. For years and years, I had to awkwardly pull out one of my camera connectors or a turbo mouse in order to transfer files to a thumb drive. Why I never investigated finding additional ports, I do not know. So, I'm not trying to do anything heavy with it; just the ease of additional ports for drives and now the new wireless keyboard that I'm typing this on. I've had it for a couple of months now and it has made my life much easier. So far, I've turned on only the first six of eight options.
customer_reviews.author: SallyM

customer_reviews.title: Did not last
customer_reviews.text: I was happy to receive this because I have a few devices to plug in. It worked well for about 3 weeks then I started to notice that the devices I plugged in started to eject from my computer without me ejecting them. Then one side of the strip would not light up then certain USB slots did not work. No happy and not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry A. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Had this for 2 1/2 years. 6 ports work fine. A few months ago when I pugged a memory stick into the second set it either didn't read it and disconnected everything I had plugged into the other 6 ports. Sometimes they would come back on line and sometimes they wouldn't. The problems were sporadic at 1st but now it always happens. I'll need to get a new hub
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Perfect USB port extension.
customer_reviews.text: The lighting is cool and I like how there are buttons to save energy, deactivating some ports you might not use. Easy to use, doesn't require reading instructions or watching any video. If you have a laptop or computer, this is a must have, as you might run out of places to plug computer-related devices or phone chargers. I have never had any issue with this and it's ultra-easy to fit in a bag for transport, even a hand bag.
customer_reviews.author: EliteReviews USA

customer_reviews.title: Want to organize all those USB drives and the iformation you have? This is a handy tool
customer_reviews.text: 8gb 16gb 64gb 128gb all over your desk, car, bag not knowing what's inside? Personally, as an IT tech, I need to be able to resolve a tech problem as quickly and as efficiently as possible. A tech is only as quick and efficient as the tools he works with. I would rate this tool as a must have in my tech room, garage, and tool bag.
customer_reviews.author: Ferdinand Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Cleans up my PC
customer_reviews.text: It's great to have only one USB hub with sockets to spare sitting next to my desktop PC. Since I work in the dark a lot, it's convenient to see available sockets and where to plug them in. My only complaint is that when charging my phone at times I'll get one quarter the power (110 mA) compared to using an A/C adapter (440 mA); I use the Ampere app to measure. I don't understand why since the hub has its own power supply. Other than that, I'm very happy with it and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: PalaDolphin

customer_reviews.title: No problems, great price.
customer_reviews.text: Some people are reporting problems with having multiple drives plugged in and running... right now, I have 4 plugged in, 2 printers, and 3 thumb drives... all running and accessible. This device is not intended to be a cell phone charger, but it will...very slowly... charge an iPhone. I have had no problems at all with this item, in the coming weeks I will be using it for an SDR trunking bank and I think that will be a good test for it.... but as for right now, I am very happy with it and all ports are still working just fine. ** the external drives used are running on their own power supplies.
customer_reviews.author: Aren

customer_reviews.title: does not work with apple cables
customer_reviews.text: my apple wires do not work with this item. Mind you, my apple wires are legit and from apple itself and were the only ones not working. so very upset. do not purchase if you have A LOT of apple items like me or else it won't work.
customer_reviews.author: gianlucca ocampo

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for Me and Longevity, fan still running after two ++years
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a powered 10 port hub that was causing all sorts of problems, unexplained, then I read some favorable comment by a group member with similar interests. My needs are to keep a small Laptop running 24/7 with dedicated use, prior older laptop fan failed via overheating and age.. fan produces a very light breeze which is fine for my needs but would not serve those looking for cooling their desk area.
customer_reviews.author: William L Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great! It has six USB ports on one end, and 7 on the other, and you can turn each group on and off. It seems to work well with external hard drives, flash drives, mice, keyboards, GPS, and everything else I've plugged into it. I'm not sure that the power supply is very powerful, however. When I plug my phone into the hub it does not charge very fast. Overall pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Lantern Photography

customer_reviews.title: Too good to be true
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. Didn't come with it's own brick, charging is slow and when it decides to work I get a "weak charging connection" notification in my devices. The blue light is very bright and lights up the room at night. The price was too good for pass, and turned out too good to be real.
customer_reviews.author: S Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Avoid this product. Transferring files across hard drives with this hub is impossible and does not work due to device disconnects and Windows reporting that devices attached to it are intermittently "unrecognized". When it does recognize them it warns that it should be connected to a high speed USB port. File transfer speeds are dead slow. Just avoid.
customer_reviews.author: m mueller

customer_reviews.title: Trash...Do NOT buy
customer_reviews.text: Worthless product. If you plug things into it, your PC says and error occurred with the usb device. If you plug your phone into it, it says "Device Not Supported" the think wont even charge a phone. It's not worth the plastic waste that was used to make it.
customer_reviews.author: Kraig Mac

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse, but with stupid-bright LEDs
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could turn off the stupid LEDs by each port. They're insanely bright. What a dumb feature. Other than that, though, it works great -- I thought I might have issues with a bunch of devices charging and a bunch of devices connected to the computer, but I've loaded it up about halfway and it's still humming along. I'm mostly using this for low speed devices (mouse/kb, usb-serial adapters) and charging; obviously it's a USB2 hub so it wouldn't work so well for hard drives or USB wifi, but it fits really well into that niche market.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I’m so disappointed. I am a elementary teacher and bought this product to charge a classroom set of iPads. Wellllllllll, this product will not even charge iPads. I have it plugged into the wall, I have cords plugged into this product, and nothing. Kind of disappointed on this purchase. Was needing something like this to charge almost 26 iPads because of my limited amount of plugins.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievably doesn't really work with my computer.
customer_reviews.text: JUpdate: They contacted me and sent a replacement unit free of charge which works great! Awesome customer service! Yay! Wish there was an option to switch off the LED lights but most units nowadays are like this. Old review: It "works" but whenever I reboot my PC it says there's an overvolt problem and doesn't go away until I unplug the hub. Recently whenever I unplug or plug something in my computer drops some USB connections... I removed this and it's works now... so... yeah. YMMV.
customer_reviews.author: dannoTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Don't forget. This is a 2.0 & not 3.0 usb hub
customer_reviews.text: iPhone doesn't recognize it in order to charge. It begins to appear to be charging my LGV20 phone; then it doesn't. Lgv20 was at 31%, went to 32%, then I look back after a few minutes, 28%. I'm disappointed. So far it charges my cool bluetooth shades&headphones. I forgot this was a 2.0 usb hub. That's why it can't charge my phones lol
customer_reviews.author: William L Hampton Jr

customer_reviews.title: Works as described, could be a little cheaper.
customer_reviews.text: First off I'd like to say that I like this item. I really needed more USB slots and this fulfills that need, so that's great. But for the price I paid, $20, it does feel kinda flimsy. I wish it had been a bit more... sturdy. I would buy again, I just wish the physical quality had been better.
customer_reviews.author: Kylan Daugherty

customer_reviews.title: this is the best usb hub that i've yet owned.
customer_reviews.text: it took me a minute to figure out the power switches and, though it's likely because i don't yet have it plugged into its own power source, i have difficulty using my external harddrives through it. on another hub of mine, i had the same trouble with my external harddrives except when i had them plugged into the extenson cords that i'd purchased at the same time that i bought this Sabrent hub, and i'll try that fix soon. do you guys have the same hub in USB 3.0? in USB-C?
customer_reviews.author: Brandon E Bolhuis

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased a number of USB hub devices over the years and found most to be cheaply made and not very durable. Granted I have bought the lower priced items and probably got what I paid for. This time I decided to spend a little more and hope for a better product and this greatly exceeded my expectations. Well made and superior in every respect than the 'value priced' hubs. Well worth the higher cost as the value received is far more than the increased price.
customer_reviews.author: James Straw

customer_reviews.title: This is a very useful item and space saving
customer_reviews.text: This is a very useful item and space saving. The only thing i don't like is the AC adapter. This is only ment for US as i can see. So i had to buy an extra AC adapter to use this HUB. The HUB itself are very useful and i am very happy to have this product. If the AC adapter was multi-national supported, 5 stars would be given. Very smart with the split-power buttons on the HUB and very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: review of Sabrent 13 Port High Speed USB 2.0 Hub with Power Adapter and 2 Control Switches (HB-U14P)
customer_reviews.text: This USB hub had more ports than anything else out there by a factor of two and I'll be using more than half of them. Has it's own AC power cord and 2 separate circuits with separate control switches. Seems well made and very happy with it so far...
customer_reviews.author: Gary C. Loos

customer_reviews.title: This thing rocks.
customer_reviews.text: I used some double stick tape to attach to the side of my pc, have never needed to use the power supply for it. this thing is perfect when you have lots of devices that needs to be connected for gaming. just hope they come out with one for usb3.0 for the same price. that would make my day!
customer_reviews.author: gamereviews

customer_reviews.title: Filled a void..not enough UBS slotts
customer_reviews.text: I was suprised when my new computer had so few USB slots that I must add external. Came with 3 slots and I have so many more things to plug in. I keep a lot of stuff on Zip drives for safety/backup. This unit fills the bill. Only complaint is that the cord is short so I had to stick the unit to the side of the case. Other than that, I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Sambeaux

customer_reviews.title: inexpensive, input line broke, too easy to push buttons
customer_reviews.text: the cable is very very short. it ended up hanging from the short tower pc. we used double sided tape to attach it, we were ginger with it and the wire cover pulled out from the case... we are doing a return and getting one with a better cable situation and no buttons to accidentally disconnect a hard drive with.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: This product has a nice blue light that guides you to the port without ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very handy device. The light helps to guide the USB connector into place. Most of the USB ports are black and well disguised, There's a lot of frustration when trying to find a USB port in the dark and getting it lined up properly, This product has a nice blue light that guides you to the port without blinding you. I like the fact that you can turn on 6 ports or all 12 at your discretion. There were no problems with Windows 10.
customer_reviews.author: js

customer_reviews.title: If Your Computer Doesn't Have Enough USB Ports, This Is The Perfect Solution!
customer_reviews.text: This hub is fantastic - the best I've ever had! After buying zillions of these hubs, I've found one that meets all my computer plug-in needs. No more unplugging one thing to plug in another. It;s especially helpful at my office. Everyone who has seen mine wants one, too. Many people didn't know such a thing existed. You cannot beat the price, the number of available ports, and the quality!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lots of ports, but the lights are super bright
customer_reviews.text: The high port count is great for using these on USB serial console setups. The lights on them are super bright blue LEDs, however, and you can't turn off the lights without turning off the ports. Would be nice if they made one of these for USB 3.0, too.
customer_reviews.author: Jim P

customer_reviews.title: So fee are so good!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something to clean up the mess of cables and usb ports and this was perfect! I taped it to my desk so it stays put and I keep the main cords plugged in. Makes my life so much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Bladestryke

customer_reviews.title: A nice addition to any laptop set up at a desk
customer_reviews.text: If you're in need of more USB space for your peripherals, look no further. This USB hub works great and has served my set up quite well at home. It's great in unison with my laptop to give me more USB ports so that I can plug in a keyboard, mouse, and even controllers when I'm at home playing games. I wouldn't recommend this for USB storage though, as it is only USB 2.0 and you might not get the data transfer speeds you are expecting.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Burch

customer_reviews.title: Very short USB to plug into your machine
customer_reviews.text: A bit upset that the built in cord (unremovable cord) is about 6" long (the power cable that comes with it is much longer). You cannot simply plug a longer USB into the other end and into your machine. So consider purchasing a USB extension cord if you need this to actually plug in to something that isn't directly next to it. Ability to open 6 and 6 ports is nice - light up is great for under desk application, and it's got mounting holes on the back so you can mount it directly against a desk or wall.
customer_reviews.author: A. Cozza

customer_reviews.title: Lots of power. Not a lot of strength.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very well aware of how some of these multi port devices tend to fail if you use them all the time but that's what I bought it for and now it's failing on me and will stop working at some point.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good design
customer_reviews.text: 5-star review is taking into account the low price, $19.99. I didn't care one way or the other when I read it had two on-off switches for ports, but now that I'm using it, I like that feature. I have several USB devices that I don't use often, including a scanner and a fax. I can keep those plugged in on one side of the hub, and leave the power off on that side until I need one of those devices. Design of the hub makes it easy to access USB ports, which face up, whether you place the hub to the right or to the left of your computer.
customer_reviews.author: J. Chapline

customer_reviews.title: Nice USB Hub
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. I do like that it is has external power as well. I have run a webcam with this and quality is the same as without going through the hub. Nicely built, feels solid.
customer_reviews.author: RadioRedman

customer_reviews.title: Failed, just out of warranty,.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in Feb, 2016, and it just died (May, 2017), meaning it is JUST out of warranty. We use it to recharge a number of different devices, and like that it has two "sections" that are separately powered. However, it seems like 15 months is a pretty short life span. I'm looking to replace it today, hopefully with something that lasts a bit longer.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Myers

customer_reviews.title: Charges a dozen Kindles great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to save space while charging 12 Kindle Fires in my classroom. Saves lots of room and works great! I haven't tried to for a quick charge because Kindles hold their charge well so making sure they're plugged in every other night keeps them charged at 100%. Having the 2 off/on switches is great because students (or family) will get into the habit of always plugging in, then you as "power strip master" can turn it on and off as needed to save power.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: This is how all technology should work...
customer_reviews.text: As one who has worked in technology for some time I have to say that I believe the best feedback that any technology can get is when a user is able to gain useful benefit from a piece of technology while basically being able to forget it's there. That has been my experience with this product. I plugged it into my MacBook Pro, added cables for things like my backup drive, iPhone connector, Fitbit charger, and an external keyboard and mouse. Then I tucked it behind the laptop and promptly forgot it was there! That is what every piece of technology should strive towards!
customer_reviews.author: Clyde

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as described.
customer_reviews.text: Slow to charge! We were very excited to use this USB Hub for our electronics, having them all in one location. Very disappointed!! Not only is it slow to charge our phones, some of the USB ports do not work properly. When both ends are charging a device, it slows down even more, and sometimes won't charge anything! Very unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Mamasita

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't come with screws!
customer_reviews.text: Listen, this is a really simple item so there's not much to review. I dropped it down one more star because it did not come with any screws to mount it was all. I actually had to take the item to Home Depot to find two screws that would actually slide into it for mounting. Otherwise, the device seems to be working well.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Expensive Nightlight!
customer_reviews.text: Avoid at all cost! This lightweight paperweight is about all it is besides lighting up bright blue. It has never worked right out of the box no matter with the ac adapter connected to the wall or to a computer. I regret wasting $20 on this plastic junk and throwing away the box it came in. It now serves as a nightlight for my kids!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: I want the AC Adapter that goes with this like it was supposed to
customer_reviews.text: All the product items didnt come. I am missing the ac adapter is missing. All the ports dont work. See pictures above. I dont want the $7.00. I dont know which one will fit. I want you to either send me the missing ac adapter or a brand new set that has all the pieces. Let know what you are going to do. Ccox7734@gmail.com. Thanks. Carole
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent power and flaky power switches
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these. They look good, and worked for a while, but the power seems inconsistent causing devices to pop in and out of recognition. Recently one of the two push button switches have started to fail on both devices (not the same switch) causing half of the ports to fail. Down to six ports on both of my thirteen port hubs.
customer_reviews.author: Scott H Stacher

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: IT'S EASY TO USE AND IT WORKS GREAT! AFTER I PLUGGED THE POWER TO IT I WAS ABLE TO ADD AS MANY CAMERAS, ETC. THAT I NEEDED TO OPERATE ON ZOOM AND OTHER FUNCTIONS.
customer_reviews.author: Donald M. Kolstad

customer_reviews.title: Works great. I use it with my Raspberry PI and ...
customer_reviews.text: Product delivered very quickly by USPS on a Sunday no less. It works great. I use it with several Raspberry PIs and several other devices that need the 5 volt power. I really like the blue back light on the ports. The blue light gives it that high tech look. When you turn out the lights it really stands out in the room. It is also very light and has a perfectly shaped power supply that doesn’t take up too much room. The power supply also has a very long cord which was perfect for my use. The ports are not too tight and allow the usb plugs to slip in nicely.
customer_reviews.author: KingKong

customer_reviews.title: Great convenience and great space-saver
customer_reviews.text: This thing is excellent. It's the first USB hub I've bought for this high a price, but come on, it's got 13 ports! I've been always running out of plugs and daisy-chaining to get all my publishing hardware and external drives and peripherals hooked up together, and with all those stupid wall warts that you can't plug into either your power strip or your wall simultaneously, it was pretty important for me to start paring down on my power strip demands. This is a great device, and is SO MUCH expansion for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mays

customer_reviews.title: Great hub. Compact and well illuminated.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Have all my peripherals connected to it so I can move them easily between two computers. Illuminated ports are making it very easy to plug cords under my desk where it lives - taped to desk side with double stick tape. Switches are convenient too if you want to disable some of the accessories plugged in without removing cable.
customer_reviews.author: Wacio

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. 13 ports in a nice strip and u can flip the switch and use half or all of them. I plug in external drives, external cd rom and they all work. I plug in my Bluetooth and cell phone and they charge just as if they were plugged into the wall. It even let's me transfer pictures from my phone to my pc, where when I had a USB 1.0 hub, it kept getting hung. this one transfers them very fast. I cannot say enough and the cost is really good. I would definitely recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Harper

customer_reviews.title: Works fantastic. Does the job for all my USB devices
customer_reviews.text: Works fantastic. Does the job for all my USB devices. Thought it was a little flimsy built, but it works well just the same. I realize there's not much there to make it have to "feel" heavy, but would have preferred something a little more "sturdy built". However, in saying all that, it connected very easity and I am quite satisfied with the product. And yes, I would recommend it to others...thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Casey K.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This made the shift to working from home a lot easier, because I was able to attach all my peripherals to my laptop that only has 2 USB ports.
customer_reviews.author: Damien d.

customer_reviews.title: This product is working exactly as I needed it to ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is working exactly as I needed it to, a warning, if you expect to be able to use larger usb powered device while charging, this is not what you're looking for. That is no problem for me, and the product allows me to have access to several usb products without trying to move my computer to get to them. I'm already considering getting more for other machines around the house.
customer_reviews.author: James Cornwell

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Brick Loot LED Lights
customer_reviews.text: Use this to power 8 sets of LED lights. No problem.
customer_reviews.author: Pgh Fan

customer_reviews.title: Great USB-2 Hub
customer_reviews.text: This 12 Port USB-2 device really comes in handy so I do not have to stand on my head to insert connectors in the back in the dark. I have the device mounted to the side of the case near the front. I also like being able to control the 6-port bank individually. I have another extender for USB-3 mounted to the top of the case. Easy...
customer_reviews.author: Jim Blaine

customer_reviews.title: Good value with good quality
customer_reviews.text: I researched many similar products before making this purchase. I decided on this one due to its value for the amount of open plugs it provided. Since receiving it, it seems to be working well is very lightweight. Overall I am satisfied with my purchase & would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: AfterDarkDuckie

customer_reviews.title: This is an Excellent USB Hub
customer_reviews.text: A great USB hub. Yes, it is USB 2.0, but if that is all you need, then this unit is perfect. Currently, I have 4 flash drives, a joystick, a Blue Yeti Pro Mic, an audio mixer, and a USB cable for charging my tablet, phone, and walkie-talkies. All this, and I still have 4 USB ports to go. Complete plug-in and start working. Great blue light aethstetic display too, with a simple and sleek design as well. A great product for the price and value.
customer_reviews.author: Centerdeal

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I needed this at my desk, with my work tablet having only one USB and no other plugs... now I can run mouse, headset, keyboard, VGA Adapter, ethernet adapter, several charging cables... all at once. Had to get a USB 3.0 Adapter too, 2.0 would not support VGA resolution higher than 800x600, but hey... for the price it was a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Not good as a charge station
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this would be a charging port for all my stuff, but nothing charges. I will still use it to plug stuff into my laptop, but it wont charge even a older mp3 player I have.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Cool

customer_reviews.title: One port not working
customer_reviews.text: I'd give this thing 5 stars if it wasn't for one port not working. All we're working fine at first then I had trouble getting a printer to communicate with my PC. I tried everything then I moved the printers USB to another port and It started working. As long as the others keep working I'll be happy. Love the blue lighting on the strip.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery B. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Attractive, low-profile powered USB hub.
customer_reviews.text: Feels sturdy and well-built. I have this installed on my desk as I use my MacBook attached to an external 4k monitor which eats up one USB port, leaving only one open USB for my mouse, keyboard, graphics tablet, and external drives. It has 2 banks of switchable USB ports that I just leave on all the time. It does glow blue around the USB ports and there's no way of turning the glow off independently of the USB banks so if you don't want the glow that is something to take into consideration.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: UNEXPECTED PLUSES WITH THIS UNIT
customer_reviews.text: I am more than pleased with this product and the blue lights are an extra plus. Highly recommend it to anyone with a computer or other kind of portable device. One added feature which I hadn't expected was when I turn on my iMac (which isn't always easy to tell when it's turned on), the blue lights of the USB hub immediately come on telling me that the computer has also activated. Pretty cool actually.
customer_reviews.author: Carnagie Thornhill

customer_reviews.title: it works like it is supposed to work
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a number of powered usb ports, but I always had the problem of the computer giving me an error message stating that there is not enough power on the USB bus, which indicates that the "powered" USB hub was actually using power from the computer. This item has worked perfectly, with all the usb ports filled, no drain on the USB buss on the computer! In other words, it works like it is supposed to work. Note: there are two buttons to shut off either half of the USB ports. If the blue LED's are not all on, look for the buttons.
customer_reviews.author: M. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Weak/loose power adapter connection
customer_reviews.text: Works good my only complain is that the power adapter plug on the actual device is super short/loose so it constantly falls out (I’m using it in a kiosk) It’s very delicate if you bump the power cord it comes out of the hub.
customer_reviews.author: Trainer Joe

customer_reviews.title: Sabrent 13 Port High Speed USB 2.0 Hub with Power Adapter And 2 Control Switches (HB-U14P)
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Power Hub to connect some exterior drives containing music, books, movies. It works very well and has the ability to shut off half or all. It is very handy when the other drives are not in use. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Blue light WAY too bright. Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Like everyone has said “great product great price.” If i didn’t have my computer in my bed room, it would be perfect. The problem is those blue lights. I can read a book in my bed room at night. I wish the lights could be turned off without turning the power off, or be dimable.
customer_reviews.author: TechGuy

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool
customer_reviews.text: Love the slim slick device that can charge 13 devices, slowly but surely. Was told by a friend of mine that the name brand SABRENT is good and he has some devices coming from this manufacturer, I trust person's judgement. I like that you can connect it to an outlet and not to have to worry about using a computer. It's meet my expectation first thing I did was to test it on 5 devices and boom, charged my samsung 5 up to 5 percent in less than 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well wish it had higher amps
customer_reviews.text: This product does exactly what it advertises and I love it for that I really really wish that it could provide higher amperage to the ports for the use of charging devices more quickly in the modern age
customer_reviews.author: Zant

customer_reviews.title: Everything works as expected even in constant use
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for about 4 months as a hon to plug in all the USB filters for my aquariums. So far so good! All work as expected
customer_reviews.author: JudyLynn

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of USB ports now.
customer_reviews.text: I have three computers and when I wanted to move my five printers plus several more USB devices I had to move them from one pc to another one manually before I got this 13 port hub. Now I simply move the USB hub connector from one pc to the next in less than 5 seconds. I am thoroughly hooked on this hub and very highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: William H. Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Handy-Does the Job Effectively
customer_reviews.text: I used the to replace three other USB adapters. It significantly reduces cord clutter and has eliminated some connection issues I had when piggybacking USB modules. If you suddenly lose access to a bank of USB ports, make sure both switches are on. If you are fumbling around trying to plug in a USB connector, you can accidentally switch off a bank. This is easy to spot, as the banks light up when active.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works... That's about it.
customer_reviews.text: Lotsa ports with power for cheap. It looks good, but there is no option to have the hub on and the lights off. The two switches control the first and last six hubs, respectively. A minor gripe of mine is that the power cable and data cable are on the same end, which makes the hub awkward to place on a desk as you have a cable coming from the back of the desk and a cable from the side of your computer going towards the same object, so you end up with a sort of Y-shape setup that is a bit cumbersome. No complaints otherwise, though.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kerekes

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: This is such a handy USB strip. My I-Mac doesn’t exactly have a lot of USB ports and between external HD’s and flash drives I was always needing to unplug some to use something else. Those days are thankfully gone plus it works double duty as a charging port also.
customer_reviews.author: Kahap

customer_reviews.title: I have tested it and it works wonderfully! Our world runs on USB plugs now
customer_reviews.text: The first product I received was a returned product. While I don't mind buying open box products, I did not purchase this as an open box and it was not at a reduced price. So I called up support. I spoke with Jonathan and he sent me a new one in a unopened box. I have tested it and it works wonderfully! Our world runs on USB plugs now, so I never had enough. Now, I have a start on having enough! Thanks for fixing the problem, thanks for the great product.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Choman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product, perfect!
customer_reviews.text: With so many various things to be plugged into a desk top computer these days, this is wonderful. Thirteen ports covers all and then some. I have at least 4 still waiting to be used, so am ready for the next items. It is slim, so it does not take up a wide space, which is perfect right behind my desktop tower. This is works wonderful, up to date, and efficient. Recommend to everyone who needs the extra USB ports.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: funny you should ask
customer_reviews.text: Almost silly to write a review on a hub but this crazy thing has two buttons, push the first one and 6 ports light up, push the second button and the other 6 ports light up. Hey, that is only 12, what about the 13th Hub? (Great title for a new book too) Well, funny you should ask! The 13th port is in the butt end of the Hub so you could probably "Daisy Chain" a few of these together if you had nothing else to do. Worked for me!
customer_reviews.author: Starcutter

customer_reviews.title: Will Buy Again
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, excellent value. Blue LED lights illuminate topside ports. Two discrete buttons--one activates first set of ports so you know they're hot, second button activates second set. Will buy again. (Only drawback: Very short cord from unit to USB connector on computer.)
customer_reviews.author: The Cloud

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for all my little bits and bobs
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for all my little bits and bobs. Down one star for the short USB cord. Also, the lights are VERY bright! I like that it's switched, so if you don't need all the ports at once, you can turn off half of them. I use this for all my short USB cables, for my phone and camera transfer cables, my Fitbit charger and Bluetooth dongle, and my USB-powered postal scale. It's also more convenient for my thumb drives, as the ports on my tower are filled with more Bluetooth dongles.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Gale

customer_reviews.title: Good USB adapter.
customer_reviews.text: Due to having limited USB ports on my computer, this was great for adding more to my computer. Easy to use and easy to plug in all my devices.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni Pascascio

customer_reviews.title: Great USB port
customer_reviews.text: I have too many items that need to be connected to my laptop (i.e. scanner, printer, Fitbit and on and on). Love this 13 port high speed USB hub - I liked it enough to purchase one for my husband's laptop as well. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Ingrid

customer_reviews.title: Sabrent Serves Well
customer_reviews.text: I could never find enough USB ports to fulfill my needs until I purchased this Sabrent Hub. I've used Sabrent external HD enclosures and there mounts for SSDs and have never experienced a problem. I anticipated none with this hub. There have been none, a slight inconvenience in that the attached USB cable should be a little longer but other than that, it has been flawless.
customer_reviews.author: Cap'n Patt

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Use on my home desktop computer and it is marvelous. Lots of USB connections. Use with my external drive. Works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Otis

customer_reviews.title: Would be perfect powered hub if it included the power adapter...
customer_reviews.text: This is a powered hub but does not come with the adapter (wall wart) needed to power it. I bought a small Sabrent powered hub and it is identical but with 4 ports instead of 13. It came with an adapter that fit this hub. I shelved the 4 port unit and just used the adapter on this one.
customer_reviews.author: David Bailey

customer_reviews.title: If you do like me and added devices over time the device malfunctions
customer_reviews.text: Don't use all of the inputs. If you do like me and added devices over time the device malfunctions. Even after I removed the second half of the device it malfunctioned. Missed the 90 day return limit. I strongly suggest if you need this many plugins get a POWERED device. I learned this from my IT son.
customer_reviews.author: RKelly

customer_reviews.title: Works great, and has plenty of ports
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a lot of USB ports on my laptop or my desktop, so this item was a necessary purchase. Yes, it operates many things. Though, my external blu-ray doesn't like any hubs at all.
customer_reviews.author: Lance M. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Not 100% sure
customer_reviews.text: Not 100% sure I am having trouble with my external hard drive when its plugged in to this. Works fine plugged in to the computer. So I'm not sure what's wrong. My head work just fine plugged into it.
customer_reviews.author: mark klein

customer_reviews.title: Good Investment
customer_reviews.text: This is a good buy. I'm not sure what camera quality is referring to at the moment; however, for what I purchased it for it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: sharon brandon

product_meta.title: Sabrent 13 Port High Speed USB 2.0 Hub with Power Adapter and 2 Control Switches (HB-U14P)
product_meta.description:
Capacity:14 PortDescription:
Add up to 13 devices quickly and easily with the Sabrent HB-U14P USB 2.0 Hub. Especially great for notebooks which come with only a few ports in an era when you need to attach many USB devices at once, such as a printer, card reader, cell phone, iPod, thumb drive, mouse, keyboard, or an external hard drive. Achieve full 480 Mbps on each port. Fully backward compatible with the USB 1.1 products. Equipped with a power supply, The hub is uniquely designed so that the two power switches can control first six or second seven USB ports with the blue Led indicators.

Features:

* Data transfer speeds up to 480 Mbps
* Add up to 127 devices by daisy-chaining multiple hubs.
* Hot-Swappable, Plug and Play, no drivers needed
* Backwards-Compatible with USB 2.0 or 1.1

What’s in the box?

* 13 Port USB 2.0 hub.
* Power adapter.

Warranty:

the product comes with a 1 year manufacturer warranty. In order for us to properly assist you, please follow these simple instructions: 
Go to www.sabrent.com/support and click 'Submit a ticket'.
Submit your ticket.
You must include your Amazon Order ID# number in the subject line.

Please Note:
For a stable connection, the devices connected to the 13 Port Hub must not exceed a combined current of 5 volt 2.5A. Each USB port on our 13 Port hub will only provide 5 volts 300 Milliamps. External hard-drives should be connected to an external power source.
This hub functions as a USB hub only, to connect USB 2.0 and USB 1.0 devices to your computer, and is not a standalone device charger.
This hub is not recommended for basic bitcoin miners.
feature_bullets: Instantly Add 13 USB 2.0 Ports to Any Compatible Device
Gain 13 Downstream Ports Which Offer High-Speed (480Mbps), Full-Speed (12Mbps), And Low-Speed (1.5Mbps)
Easy Setup, Plug-n-Play, Hot Swappable, Hot Pluggable
Backwards Compatible With 1.1 Devices and Hosts
Add up to 127 Devices by Daisy-Chaining Multiple Hubs

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,959 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
